query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Avvegna che la subitana fuga 2 dispergesse color per la campagna, 3 rivolti al monte ove ragion ne fruga,
query.error: **English:** 1 Although the sudden flight 2 scattered those colors across the countryside, 3 we turned to the mountain where reason urges us,
query.result: 1 Þeah ðe seo hrade fluht 2 tosprædde ða heowas geond ða feldas, 3 we wendon to ðæm munte ðær riht us trymde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 i’ mi ristrinsi a la fida compagna: 5 e come sare’ io sanza lui corso? 6 chi m’avria tratto su per la montagna?
query.error: **English:** 4 I drew close to my faithful companion: 5 and how would I have fared without him? 6 Who would have led me up the mountain?
query.result: 4 ic me gefæstnode to ðæm treowfæstan gefēran: 5 and hu mæg ic wesan butan him? 6 hwa mæg me lædan upp ofer ðone munt?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 El mi parea da sé stesso rimorso: 8 o dignitosa coscïenza e netta, 9 come t’è picciol fallo amaro morso!
query.error: **English:** 7 He seemed to me remorseful of himself: 8 O dignified and pure conscience, 9 how a small fault is a bitter pang to you!
query.result: 7 He me þuhte ðæt he wære gehreowig be him sylfum: 8 ea, wyrðfulle and hluttre gewiðerhygd, 9 hu ðe is lyt ðæs unrihtes earh ðin bitre morð!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Quando li piedi suoi lasciar la fretta, 11 che l’onestade ad ogn’ atto dismaga, 12 la mente mia, che prima era ristretta,
query.error: **English:** 10 When his feet abandoned their haste, 11 which propriety enfeebles in every action, 12 my mind, which was previously constrained,
query.result: 10 Þa ða his fet forleton ða hrade, 11 ðe ðæt gesceadwisnes æt æghwylcum dædum awæcð, 12 min mod, ðe ær wæs gebunden,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 lo ’ntento rallargò, sì come vaga, 14 e diedi ’l viso mio incontr’ al poggio 15 che ’nverso ’l ciel più alto si dislaga.
query.error: **English:** 13 expanded its intention, as if eager, 14 and I turned my face towards the hill 15 that rises highest towards the sky.
query.result: 13 hit awedde ðone willan, swa swa geornful, 14 and ic geaf min andwlita ongean ðone beorg 15 ðe ofer ðone heofona heahstan stigeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Lo sol, che dietro fiammeggiava roggio, 17 rotto m’era dinanzi a la figura, 18 ch’avëa in me de’ suoi raggi l’appoggio.
query.error: **English:** 16 The sun, which was flaming red behind me, 17 was broken in front of me by the figure, 18 which had the support of its rays in me.
query.result: 16 Seo sunne, ðe ðær scân beæftan me read, 17 wæs me beforan on ðære siccle brægd, 18 ðe ðara his leoma on me hæfde leoht.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Io mi volsi dallato con paura 20 d’essere abbandonato, quand’ io vidi 21 solo dinanzi a me la terra oscura;
query.error: **English:** 19 I turned to the side with fear 20 of being abandoned, when I saw 21 only the dark earth before me;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 e ’l mio conforto: «Perché pur diffidi?», 23 a dir mi cominciò tutto rivolto; 24 «non credi tu me teco e ch’io ti guidi?
query.error: **English:** 22 and my comfort, "Why do you still doubt?", 23 began to say to me, turning to me completely; 24 "Do you not believe that I am with you and that I am guiding you?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Vespero è già colà dov’ è sepolto 26 lo corpo dentro al quale io facea ombra; 27 Napoli l’ha, e da Brandizio è tolto.
query.error: **English:** 25 Evening is already there where the body 26 in which I cast a shadow is buried; 27 Naples holds it, and it is taken from Brindisi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Ora, se innanzi a me nulla s’aombra, 29 non ti maravigliar più che d’i cieli 30 che l’uno a l’altro raggio non ingombra.
query.error: **English:** 28 Now, if nothing casts a shadow before me, 29 do not be more amazed than at the heavens, 30 that one does not obstruct the other's light.
query.result: 28 Nu, gif nanwuht ðe beforan sceaðu, 29 ne wundrige ðe ðæs mare ðonne ðæs heofones, 30 ðæt ðæt an ðæs oðres leoht ne letteð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 A sofferir tormenti, caldi e geli 32 simili corpi la Virtù dispone 33 che, come fa, non vuol ch’a noi si sveli.
query.error: **English:** 31 To suffer torments, hot and cold, 32 such bodies the Power disposes, 33 which, as it does, does not want to reveal itself to us.
query.result: 31 To ðoligenne ða geswinc, ða hatan and ða cealdan, 32 swa gegearwode ða lichoman ðæt Miht, 33 ðe ðæs ne gymde ðæt hit us wurde cuð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Matto è chi spera che nostra ragione 35 possa trascorrer la infinita via 36 che tiene una sustanza in tre persone.
query.error: **English:** 34 Mad is he who hopes that our reason 35 can traverse the infinite path 36 that a single substance holds in three persons.
query.result: 34 Dysig is se ðe wenð ðæt ure geþoht 35 mæge ðurhseon ðone unasecgendlican weg 36 ðe anfealdnys hafað on ðrim hadum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 e disïar vedeste sanza frutto 41 tai che sarebbe lor disio quetato, 42 ch’etternalmente è dato lor per lutto:
query.error: **English:** 40 and you would have seen in vain those 41 whose desire would have been satisfied, 42 to whom eternal mourning is given as their lot:
query.result: 40 and ġē ġesāwon on īdel ðā 41 ðe hiora ġefēa ġefylled wurde, 42 ðǣm ēce murnung is for hiora hleote ġesett:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 io dico d’Aristotile e di Plato 44 e di molt’ altri»; e qui chinò la fronte, 45 e più non disse, e rimase turbato.
query.error: **English:** 43 I speak of Aristotle and Plato 44 and many others"; and here he bowed his head, 45 and said no more, and remained troubled.
query.result: 43 ic secge be Aristotele and be Platone 44 and be manegum ōðrum"; and hēr hē ġehneigde his neb, 45 and nān māre ne cwæð, and wæs ġedrēfed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Noi divenimmo intanto a piè del monte; 47 quivi trovammo la roccia sì erta, 48 che ’ndarno vi sarien le gambe pronte.
query.error: **English:** 46 We came to the foot of the mountain; 47 there we found the rock so steep, 48 that our agile legs would have been in vain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Tra Lerice e Turbìa la più diserta, 50 la più rotta ruina è una scala, 51 verso di quella, agevole e aperta.
query.error: **English:** 49 Between Lerici and Turbia, the most deserted, 50 the most broken ruin is a staircase, 51 compared to which, this one is easy and open.
query.result: 49 Betwux Lerice and Turbìa ðæt mæste weste, 50 ðæt mæste torrofene torr is a stegere, 51 wið ðone, ðeos is esðe and open.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 «Or chi sa da qual man la costa cala», 53 disse ’l maestro mio fermando ’l passo, 54 «sì che possa salir chi va sanz’ ala?».
query.error: **English:** 52 "Now who knows on which hand the slope descends," 53 said my master, stopping his step, 54 "so that he who goes without wings can climb it?"
query.result: 52 "Hwæt! Hwa mæg nu secgan on hwylcere sidan ðeos clif astige," 53 cwæð min lareow, ða he his gang forstod, 54 "ðæt mæge gestigan se ðe fotum gæð?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 E mentre ch’e’ tenendo ’l viso basso 56 essaminava del cammin la mente, 57 e io mirava suso intorno al sasso,
query.error: **English:** 55 And while he, keeping his face down, 56 was examining the path in his mind, 57 and I was looking up around the rock,
query.result: 55 And ða ða he, healdende his neb adūn, 56 smeagende wæs ðæs weges on his mode, 57 and ic up locade ymbe ðone stan,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 da man sinistra m’apparì una gente 59 d’anime, che movieno i piè ver’ noi, 60 e non pareva, sì venïan lente.
query.error: **English:** 58 on my left hand there appeared to me a group 59 of souls, who were moving their feet towards us, 60 and they did not seem to be coming quickly.
query.result: 58 ða on ða wynstran hond me ætywde 59 sawla gedryht, ða ða ferdon him wið, 60 and ne wæs hyra cyme swylce hy cumen sceoldon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 «Leva», diss’ io, «maestro, li occhi tuoi: 62 ecco di qua chi ne darà consiglio, 63 se tu da te medesmo aver nol puoi».
query.error: **English:** 61 "Arise," I said, "master, your eyes: 62 behold, here is one who will give us counsel, 63 if you cannot have it from yourself."
query.result: 61 "Aris," cwæð ic, "larew, ðine eagan: 62 her is se ðe ræd agifan mæg, 63 gif ðu ðurh ðe selfne ne miht."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Guardò allora, e con libero piglio 65 rispuose: «Andiamo in là, ch’ei vegnon piano; 66 e tu ferma la spene, dolce figlio».
query.error: **English:** 64 He looked then, and with free rein 65 he replied: "Let us go over there, for they come slowly; 66 and you, sweet son, keep your hope firm."
query.result: 64 He ða geseah and mid ðæs leoman 65 andswarode and ðus cwæð: "Gonge we furðor, 66 ðu ðe fæste ðine hyht, min se leofa sunu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Ancora era quel popol di lontano, 68 i’ dico dopo i nostri mille passi, 69 quanto un buon gittator trarria con mano,
query.error: **English:** 67 That folk was still far away, 68 I say after our thousand paces, 69 as far as a good thrower could throw with his hand,
query.result: 67 Þæt folc wæs giet ða giet feorran, 68 ic secge æfter ðusendum minum, 69 swa feor swa man mihte mid handa gewiðan,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 quando si strinser tutti ai duri massi 71 de l’alta ripa, e stetter fermi e stretti 72 com’ a guardar, chi va dubbiando, stassi.
query.error: **English:** 70 when they all gathered at the hard rocks 71 of the high bank, and stood firm and close 72 like one who stands watching, full of doubt.
query.result: 70 ða hie to ðæm heardan stane 71 ðære hean hrycgæ samod ætgædere, 72 swa swa se ðe wæccende bið, ðær he weneð findan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 ditene dove la montagna giace, 77 sì che possibil sia l’andare in suso; 78 ché perder tempo a chi più sa più spiace».
query.error: **English:** 76 tell us where the mountain lies, 77 so that it may be possible to go up; 78 for losing time is most displeasing to those who know more."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Come le pecorelle escon del chiuso 80 a una, a due, a tre, e l’altre stanno 81 timidette atterrando l’occhio e ’l muso;

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 e ciò che fa la prima, e l’altre fanno, 83 addossandosi a lei, s’ella s’arresta, 84 semplici e quete, e lo ’mperché non sanno;
query.error: **English:** 82 and what the first one does, the others do, 83 huddling close to her if she stops, 84 simple and quiet, and they do not know why;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 sì vid’ io muovere a venir la testa 86 di quella mandra fortunata allotta, 87 pudica in faccia e ne l’andare onesta.
query.error: **English:** 85 so I saw the head of that fortunate flock 86 begin to move forward then, 87 modest in appearance and dignified in movement.
query.result: 85 swa ic ða ðære heorde heafod geseah 86 ðære gesæligan ða ða heo ðær forð eode, 87 ða ðe ða gesibsumlice on ðam ansyne wæs and ða ða gesibsumlice eode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Come color dinanzi vider rotta 89 la luce in terra dal mio destro canto, 90 sì che l’ombra era da me a la grotta,
query.error: **English:** 88 As color in face of one who flees in rout, 89 the light on earth from my right side, 90 so that the shadow was from me to the cave,
query.result: 88 Swa ðæs monnes hiw æt ðære ræste, 89 ðe on fleame bið for his feonde, 90 ðæt his sceadu bið on ðære swiðran healfe,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 restaro, e trasser sé in dietro alquanto, 92 e tutti li altri che venieno appresso, 93 non sappiendo ’l perché, fenno altrettanto.
query.error: **English:** 91 I stopped, and drew back a little, 92 and all the others who were coming behind, 93 not knowing why, did the same.
query.result: 91 ic ðær stod, and ða oðre ealle, 92 ðe me æfter comon, ða ic ðær cearde, 93 ne wiston hwi, ða ðe ðær æfter comon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 «Sanza vostra domanda io vi confesso 95 che questo è corpo uman che voi vedete; 96 per che ’l lume del sole in terra è fesso.
query.error: **English:** 94 "Without your asking, I confess to you 95 that this is a human body that you see; 96 because of which the light of the sun is split on the earth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Non vi maravigliate, ma credete 98 che non sanza virtù che da ciel vegna 99 cerchi di soverchiar questa parete».
query.error: **English:** 97 Do not marvel, but believe 98 that not without virtue that comes from heaven 99 do I seek to overcome this wall.
query.result: 97 Ne wundrige ðe, ac gelef ðæt 98 ðæt nis butan mihte ðe of heofonum cymeð 99 ðæt ic ðas weallas oferwinnan wille.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Così ’l maestro; e quella gente degna 101 «Tornate», disse, «intrate innanzi dunque», 102 coi dossi de le man faccendo insegna.
query.error: **English:** 100 Thus the master; and that worthy people 101 "Turn back," he said, "enter now therefore," 102 making a sign with the backs of their hands.
query.result: 100 Þus cwæð se lareow; and ða leofan men 101 "Gewitað," cwæð he, "gað nu forð," 102 mid ðæra handa bæce tacen wyrcende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 E un di loro incominciò: «Chiunque 104 tu se’, così andando, volgi ’l viso: 105 pon mente se di là mi vedesti unque».
query.error: **English:** 103 And one of them began: "Whoever 104 you are, thus going, turn your face: 105 consider if you ever saw me before."
query.result: 103 And ða anra ðara ðus cwæð: "Hwa ðu 104 swa farende ðisne weg findest, 105 geseoh ðu ðe ðær ær gesawe?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Io mi volsi ver’ lui e guardail fiso: 107 biondo era e bello e di gentile aspetto, 108 ma l’un de’ cigli un colpo avea diviso.
query.error: **English:** 106 I turned to him and looked at him intently: 107 he was blond and handsome and of noble appearance, 108 but one of his eyebrows had been split by a blow.
query.result: 106 Ic me wende ða to him and beheold hine fæste: 107 he wæs geolu and fæger and æðele on ansyne, 108 ac he hæfde an ðam anan bryne on ðam ehbrywe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Quand’ io mi fui umilmente disdetto 110 d’averlo visto mai, el disse: «Or vedi»; 111 e mostrommi una piaga a sommo ’l petto.
query.error: **English:** 109 When I had humbly denied 110 ever having seen him, he said: “Now look”; 111 and he showed me a wound on his chest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Poi sorridendo disse: «Io son Manfredi, 113 nepote di Costanza imperadrice; 114 ond’ io ti priego che, quando tu riedi,
query.error: **English:** 112 Then smiling he said: "I am Manfred, 113 grandson of the Empress Constance; 114 and therefore I beg you that, when you return,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 vadi a mia bella figlia, genitrice 116 de l’onor di Cicilia e d’Aragona, 117 e dichi ’l vero a lei, s’altro si dice.
query.error: **English:** 115 go to my beautiful daughter, mother 116 of the honor of Sicily and Aragon, 117 and tell her the truth, if other things are being said.
query.result: 115 far to mīnum fægeran dehter, mōdor 116 ðæs wuldres Sicilia and Aragōna, 117 and sege hire ðæt sōð, gif hit elles is sægd."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Poscia ch’io ebbi rotta la persona 119 di due punte mortali, io mi rendei, 120 piangendo, a quei che volontier perdona.
query.error: **English:** 118 After I had broken my body 119 with two deadly wounds, I surrendered myself, 120 weeping, to him who willingly forgives.
query.result: 118 Siððan ic hæfde rofen ða gesceaft 119 mid twæm deadlicum dolgum, ic me sealde, 120 wepende, ðam ðe georne forgifð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Orribil furon li peccati miei; 122 ma la bontà infinita ha sì gran braccia, 123 che prende ciò che si rivolge a lei.
query.error: **English:** 121 My sins were horrible; 122 but the infinite goodness has such great arms, 123 that it embraces whoever turns to it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Se ’l pastor di Cosenza, che a la caccia 125 di me fu messo per Clemente allora, 126 avesse in Dio ben letta questa faccia,
query.error: **English:** 124 If the shepherd of Cosenza, who at that time 125 was sent by Clement to hunt me down, 126 had read this face of mine well in God,
query.result: 124 Gif se hyrde of Cosenza, ðe ða on huntode 125 wæs ofer me gesend fram Clemente, 126 hæfde on Gode ðisne andwlætan wel gerædd,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 l’ossa del corpo mio sarieno ancora 128 in co del ponte presso a Benevento, 129 sotto la guardia de la grave mora.
query.error: **English:** 127 the bones of my body would still be 128 at the head of the bridge near Benevento, 129 under the watch of the heavy pile of stones.
query.result: 127 ða ban of minum lice lægen wæron 128 æt heafdon ðæs brycge neah Bineuente, 129 under ðære hefigan stanes heorde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Or le bagna la pioggia e move il vento 131 di fuor dal regno, quasi lungo ’l Verde, 132 dov’ e’ le trasmutò a lume spento.
query.error: **English:** 130 Now the rain soaks them and the wind moves them 131 outside the realm, almost along the Verde River, 132 where he transformed them with the light extinguished.
query.result: 130 Nu hi ða rén baðað and ðone wind hweorfað 131 útan ðæs ríces, swá néah ðæm Wírhealfe, 132 ðær hé hí gewende mid leohte ácweced.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Per lor maladizion sì non si perde, 134 che non possa tornar, l’etterno amore, 135 mentre che la speranza ha fior del verde.
query.result:
**English:**
133 Through their maledictions the eternal love 134 cannot be lost, so that it cannot return, 135 as long as hope has a flower of green.
**Old English:**
133 For heora malison ne bið se eðelice lofu forluren, 134 þæt he ne mæge eft cuman, 135 þenden de seo hyht hæbbeð blostman grænes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Vero è che quale in contumacia more 137 di Santa Chiesa, ancor ch’al fin si penta, 138 star li convien da questa ripa in fore,
query.error: **English:** 136 It is true that whoever dies in contempt 137 of Holy Church, even if he repents at the end, 138 must remain outside this bank for a time,
query.result: 136 Soð is ðætte se ðe on unrihtwisnesse forðferde 137 of Godes gelaðunge, ðeah ðe he æt ðam ende gebuge, 138 sceal standan be ðisse ofre ðritigfealdne,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 per ognun tempo ch’elli è stato, trenta, 140 in sua presunzïon, se tal decreto 141 più corto per buon prieghi non diventa.
query.result:
**English:**
139 for every time that he has been there, thirty, 140 in his presumption, if such a decree 141 does not become shorter through good prayers.
**Old English:**
139 for æghwylce tíman ðe he ðær wæs, ðrítig, 140 on hís ofermóde, gif ðæt dóm ne bið 141 ðurh góde béna gebræded swíðor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Vedi oggimai se tu mi puoi far lieto, 143 revelando a la mia buona Costanza 144 come m’hai visto, e anco esto divieto;
query.error: **English:** 142 See now if you can make me glad, 143 by revealing to my good Constance 144 how you have seen me, and also this prohibition;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 ché qui per quei di là molto s’avanza».
query.error: **English:** 145 for here, through those from there, much is gained.
query.result: 145 forðæm ðær ðurh ða ðe ðanon syndon micel is geðungen.
